result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Sarah Ann Melton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence w/held probation 1 year - no contact with Richard Capelle, Jr. - Restituion jt/several $6325.30 plus 10% surcharge - costs $243.00

miscConds.notes: $6325.30 restitution and surcharge of $632.53 total of $6957.83 joint and Several   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Costs of $243.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact with Richard Capelle Jr.

records.addlTxt: From DOC

Defendant Sarah Ann Melton in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  9:08 AM  Court calls case.  Court makes stmt - still financial obligations owing as of 9/1/16.  DE makes stmt.  State addressed the court - moved to dismiss felony count.  Court motion is granted to dismiss charge subject to deferred judgment .  DE addressed the Court.    Court DE discharged from probation all unpaid fines/costs/rest. are converted to civil judgment.
Discharge 12/9/16

1 - Medical Record of victim
Count 1 DGPA for 1 year

Defendant Sarah Ann Melton in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moved to amend count 2 to misd. battery 940.19(1) will plead to and count 1 as a DGPA.  Court grants motion to amend count 2.  Defendant entered plea of no contest to counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 2 - count 1 plea is accepted and defers entry of judgment for 1 year.  Exhibit 1 - Medical bill off'd by State / Rec'd by the Court

Court:  Count 2 - Sentence w/held probation 1 year - no contact with Richard Capelle, Jr. - Restituion jt/several $6325.30 plus 10% surcharge - costs $243.00  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Sarah Ann Melton in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  1:04 PM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court appears via video conference.  Atty Gramstrup no agreement - defendant can not afford to pay him any longer DE wants to dismiss him as atty because she needs to obtain a public defender.  Court questions Atty Gramstrup re: her eligibility for a public defender.  Court addressed the defendant.  Court will not allow Atty Gramstrup to w/draw as atty - case will go to trial next week.  Atty's to be here at 8:15 AM on 12/9/15.  Atty's to notify the Judge and Clerk of Court by 3PM 12/8/15 if jury is off.

Final pre-trial at 12-02-2015 01:00 pm.
Jury trial at 12-09-2015 09:00 am.

Defendant Sarah Ann Melton in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Gramstrup requests trial date be set 1 day.  Jury trial scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Scheduling conference at 09-04-2015 11:15 am
